meanings.definition: To remove from the position or status of a clergy member.
meanings.sent1: The bishop disfrocks the priest for his misconduct.
meanings.sent2: The church council decided to disfrock the reverend due to his actions.
meanings.sent3: It was quite a sight when the bishop accidentally disfrocked himself during the ceremony.
meanings.sent4: The sudden scandal disfrocked the once-respected clergyman in the eyes of the community.
meanings.sent5: The act of disfrocking the priest was a solemn and irreversible decision.

meanings.definition: To strip of the official garments or uniform.
meanings.sent1: The soldier disfrocks before entering the barracks.
meanings.sent2: The team captain disfrocks after the game to relax.
meanings.sent3: In a hilarious mix-up, the magician accidentally disfrocks his assistant instead of the volunteer.
meanings.sent4: The storm's strong winds seemed to disfrock the trees of their leaves overnight.
meanings.sent5: The ceremonial disfrocking of the old uniform marked the beginning of a new era for the organization.
